meanings.sent1: She gibbers when she gets excited about something.
meanings.sent2: The child gibbers with joy when playing with his toys.
meanings.sent3: The parrot gibbers in a funny way, trying to mimic human speech.
meanings.sent4: The engine gibbers loudly before finally starting up.
meanings.sent5: The old radio gibbers before finally tuning in to the right station.

meanings.sent1: I couldn't understand his gibbers about aliens visiting Earth.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech was full of gibbers and empty promises.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's gibbers had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a gibbers of worries and fears.
meanings.sent5: The book was filled with gibbers that made no sense at all.

meanings.definition: A jumble or confusion of sounds
meanings.sent1: The forest was alive with the gibbers of various animals.
meanings.sent2: The city street echoed with the gibbers of traffic and people.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was filled with the gibbers of excited students.
meanings.sent4: The storm outside created a gibbers of wind and rain.
meanings.sent5: The market was a gibbers of vendors calling out their wares.
